title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
description: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.
author: Alyssa Roenigk

title: Suarez, managers suspended for Padres-L.A. feud
description: Major League Baseball has suspended Padres reliever Robert Suarez for three games (pending appeal) and managers Mike Shildt and Dave Roberts for one each, the aftermath of a feud between the teams that boiled over Thursday night in L.A.

title: Dodgers' Roki Sasaki resumes his throwing program in recovery from shoulder injury
description: Los Angeles Dodgers right-hander Roki Sasaki has restarted his throwing program as he continues his recovery from a right shoulder injury. Manager Dave Roberts said the 23-year-old phenom threw from 60 to 90 feet Friday in his return to workouts after a brief pause. “That was a bonus,” Roberts said.
author: GREG BEACHAM

title: Arkansas freshman infielder enters transfer portal
description: Arkansas lost its fifth player thus far to the current transfer portal cycle on Friday when freshman infielder Gabe

title: Vaughan 'staggered' by England decision to bowl
description: Former captain Michael Vaughan says he was “staggered” by England’s decision to field first after India piled on 359-3 on day one of the first Test at Headingley.

title: Lions beaten by Argentina in pre-tour Dublin thriller
description: The British and Irish Lions warm up for their Australian tour in deflating fashion as they fall to a slick and pacey Argentina side in Dublin.

title: Premier League fixtures: Man Utd host Arsenal on bumper opening weekend
description: Manchester United host Arsenal in the first Super Sunday of the 2025/26 Premier League season, with Liverpool, Manchester City, Chelsea and FA Cup winners Crystal Palace also featuring live on Sky Sports on a bumper opening weekend.

title: Gill, Jaiswal hit hundreds as India dominate under-par England
description: New captain Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal struck centuries as India punished an under-par England bowling display to pile on 359-3 after losing the toss on day one of the first Test at Headingley.
